intro: Gilia foetida, commonly known as stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, with a strong, unpleasant odor. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Gilia foetida is often found in dry, disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun.
